qas.question: What type of installations are hydraulic elevators best suited for?
Why do hydraulic elevators use more energy?

answers.text: the pump works against gravity to push the car and its passengers upwards; this energy is lost when the car descends on its own weight

qas.question: What else contributes to a higher demand from the electrical system?

answers.text: The high current draw of the pump when starting up

qas.question: What concerns arise when the lifting cylinder leaks fluid into the ground?

context: The low mechanical complexity of hydraulic elevators in comparison to traction elevators makes them ideal for <a0_0>low rise, low traffic installations<a0_0/>. They are less energy efficient as <a1_0>the pump works against gravity to push the car and its passengers upwards; this energy is lost when the car descends on its own weight<a1_0/>. <a2_0>The high current draw of the pump when starting up<a2_0/> also places higher demands on a building’s electrical system. There are also <a3_0>environmental concerns<a3_0/> should the lifting cylinder leak fluid into the ground.
